page.title: 19FARMING: High Bank Farm.
page.content: This is situated next to High Bank Nursing home on Walshaw Road in Bury. The farmer owns 50 acres of land and rents a further 40 acres.The farm house is over 100 years old. However it has been modernised, and a milking parlour has been built.The farm uses gas and elecricity.They have tractors to plough the land and own 18 different machines. They have five different types of animals:- cows, pigs, horses, ducks and chickens.They identify their animals with either a number stamped across their shoulders, or an ear-clip It is a pastoral farm, and no crops except grass are grown. On average the farm has to be worked on 12 hours a day.
